intro: Ayapanopsis tucumanensis, commonly known as the Tucumán ayapana, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
